title: 🛠 Slack Not Updating on Mac – Here’s What to Do
content: What’s going on? If Slack isn’t updating or looks like it’s stuck (like showing "Downloading Update" with no progress), don’t worry. Follow the steps below to get things back on track. 1. If You See “Downloading Update” and Nothing Happens Slack can sometimes get stuck here. Here's how to fix it: Quit Slack : Click Slack in the top-left menu bar. Select Quit Slack . Wait about 10 seconds. [Image] Reopen Slack . Move on to the next step to check for updates manually. 2. Manually Check for Updates Once Slack is open again: Click Slack in the top-left menu. [Image] Select Check for Updates . If it finds something, click Restart to Apply Update . [Image] 3. Clear the App Cache Still not working quite right? Try clearing the app’s cache: Click Help in the menu bar. Go to Troubleshooting > Clear Cache and Restart . This helps reset Slack without removing your settings. 4. Reinstall Slack (Clean Start) If the issue sticks around, a fresh install usually does the trick: Quit Slack again. Drag Slack to the Trash . Here’s a helpful guide if you need it: How to Uninstall Apps on Mac Reinstall from here: Download Slack for Mac Once downloaded, you’ll see a screen like this. Drag the Slack icon into the Applications folder to complete installation: [Image] 5. Still Having Trouble? If nothing’s working, it’s time to loop in support. Drop a message in #digital-workplace and someone will help you out.
